str2: Genitive case of an interrogative pronoun pos otherwise obsolete; as adverb of place; at what locality.
Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
The act of boasting, glorying, exultation. From kauchaomai; boasting, in a good or a bad sense.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To shut out, exclude, separate. From ek and kleio; to shut out.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: Of what sort. From the base of pou and hoios; individualizing interrogative what sort of, or which one.
From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
By no means, not at all. Intensive of ou; not indeed.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
From a primary nemo; law, genitive case, specially, (including the volume); also of the Gospel), or figuratively.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
